hackathon-description-text: Americans have lost faith in our system of governance. 96% of voters agree that money in politics is a problem, but 91% don’t think it can be fixed.
hackathon-eligibility: We're looking for skilled web and software developers, user interface designers, graphic designers, and marketing professionals to work on a variety of projects.
hackathon-requirements: Small teams will work together over 2 days on whichever project they choose. All projects will be presented at the conclusion of the event.
hackathon-rules: All original submissions to Hack for Democracy remain the intellectual property of the individuals that developed them. Your creation is yours to share or sell as you see fit. We encourage participants to share their projects as open source and/or Creative Commons to promote innovation in this space.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Judges Choice: Technical Project, Existing Project
Judges Choice: Marketing Project (if there are at least 2)
People’s Choice: By popular vote. (This is for the democracy movement, after all!)

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=315 Montgomery Street, San Francisco, CA 94104, USA
hackathon-location-address: 315 Montgomery Street, San Francisco, CA 94104, USA
hackathon-description-header: Design, Technology, and Marketing Hackers Wanted!
